excerpt: Ancient castle built on a rocky hilltop, offering panoramic views of the city in all directions.
detail_description: Ankara Castle, an ancient fortress perched on a rocky hill, provides breathtaking panoramic views of the city. With its strong fortifications and intricate architecture, this historic site offers visitors a glimpse into Turkey's past. The castle has been used by various civilizations for defense and settlement over its 4,000-year history and has undergone numerous repairs. Inside the castle, there are houses dating back to different historical periods, providing insight into the area's evolution.
name: Ankara Castle
address: Kale, 06240 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Colonnaded tomb for the former president, Kemal Ataturk, with a marble hall, turrets & museum.
detail_description: Anıtkabir in Ankara is a grand mausoleum and museum dedicated to Kemal Ataturk, the founding father and first president of the Republic of Turkey. It also serves as the final resting place for Ismet Inonu, Turkey's second president. The site features a marble hall, turrets, murals, and art galleries. The Ataturk Museum within Anıtkabir displays his personal items, medals, wardrobe, and gifts received during his lifetime.
name: Anıtkabir
address: Mebusevleri, Anıttepe, Anıtkabir, 06570 Çankaya/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Museum of artifacts from the Paleolithic era to the classical period, some displayed in a courtyard.
detail_description: The Museum of Anatolian Civilizations, situated on the south side of Ankara Castle, houses an extensive and unique collection of artifacts from Anatolia's significant archaeological sites. The exhibits are displayed in chronological order, spanning from the Paleolithic era to the Ottoman period.
name: Museum of Anatolian Civilizations
address: Kale, Gözcü Sk. No:2, 06240 Ulus/Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Built 1967–1987, this neoclassical Ottoman-style mosque is the city's largest, accommodating 24,000.
detail_description: Kocatepe Mosque, a stunning example of neoclassical Ottoman architecture, stands as the largest mosque in Ankara and one of Turkey's most impressive religious structures. Completed between 1967 and 1987, it boasts an expansive area of 4,500 square meters that can accommodate over 24,000 worshippers. Perched on Kocatepe Hill, this architectural marvel features four soaring minarets and a grand central dome that captures the eye from afar.
name: Kocatepe Mosque
address: Kültür, Dr. Mediha Eldem Sk. No:67, 06420 Çankaya/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Landmark mosque that was built during the Ottoman era & is still in use today.
detail_description: The Haci Bayram Mosque, constructed in the 15th century by Architect Mehmet Bey, is a significant Ottoman-era landmark located in Ulus. The mosque features brick outer walls on stone and is accompanied by the Haci Bayram-i Veli Tomb. Named after the prominent religious scholar Haci Bayram Veli, it reflects a blend of Seljuk and early Ottoman architectural styles with intricate tile work and ornate calligraphy.
name: Haci Bayram Mosque
address: Hacı Bayram, Sarıbağ Sk. No:13, 06050 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Light-filled retail mall offering boutiques, cafes, eateries & a cinema, plus an observation tower.
detail_description: Atakule, situated in the Cankaya district of Ankara, is a must-visit destination offering a unique blend of retail therapy, dining experiences, and breathtaking views. Standing tall at 125 meters, this iconic tower provides unparalleled panoramic vistas of Ankara. The revolving restaurant within Atakule offers an exceptional dining experience with ever-changing urban landscapes as it rotates. From this vantage point, visitors can marvel at the city's rich history and diverse civilizations that once thrived here.
name: Atakule
address: Çankaya, Çankaya Cd., 06690 Çankaya/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Private museum with archaeological artifacts, a cafe & an exhibition hall hosting events & concerts.
detail_description: Nestled across from the main entrance of Ankara Castle, the Erimtan Archaeology and Art Museum is a private museum housed in three historical Ankara houses. Established by Yuksel Erimtan, it features over 2,000 archaeological artifacts dating from prehistoric ages to Byzantine times. The museum also hosts events and concerts in its exhibition hall and boasts a cafe for visitors to enjoy.
name: Erimtan Archaeology and Art Museum
address: Kale, Gözcü Sk. No:10, 06240 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Popular green space featuring an outdoor theater, artificial lake with light shows & amusement park.
detail_description: Gençlik Park in Ankara is a popular green space that offers a variety of attractions for visitors. The park features an outdoor theater, an artificial lake with light shows, and an amusement park known as Ankara Luna Park. It also boasts two small trains, a swimming pool, and walking paths spread across its vast 70-acre area. At night, the park comes alive with colorful lights, providing entertainment for both day and night.
name: Gençlik Park
address: Doğanbey Mahallesi, Atatürk Blv No:50, 06050 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Museum chronicling progress in transit & science, with artifacts from rare cars to medical tools.
detail_description: The Rahmi M. Koc Museum in Ankara, Turkey is a top destination for car enthusiasts and families alike. The museum offers a fascinating exploration of the progress in transportation and science, featuring rare cars, medical tools, boats, old warplanes, small cars, and more. Visitors can stroll through the beautifully restored historical building to discover an extensive collection of artifacts that illustrate the development of the automotive industry.
name: Rahmi M. Koc Museum Ankara
address: Kale, Hacettepe, Depo Sokak No:1, 06230 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Ancient ruins featuring walls inscribed with a funerary tribute to the 1st Roman emperor, Augustus.
detail_description: The Temple of Augustus in Ankara is an ancient site dating back to the 2nd century AD. It features well-preserved inscriptions of Emperor Augustus' last will and testament, known as the Res Gestae Divi Augusti. The temple was originally built to celebrate Galatia's entry into the Roman Empire and demonstrate loyalty to Emperor Augustus. Over time, it underwent transformations, including conversion into a church during the Byzantine period.
name: Temple of Augustus
address: Hacı Bayram, 06030 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Open-air museum at the ruins of an ancient Roman bath complex dating to the 3rd century CE.
detail_description: The Roman Baths and Open Air Museum in Ankara offer a glimpse into the ancient Roman bath complex dating back to the 3rd century CE. Built by Emperor Caracalla, these baths featured hot, warm, and cold rooms. Despite being destroyed by fire in the 8th century, the ruins still exude an aura of historical grandeur. Visitors can explore little stories, statues, and inscriptions that provide insights into Roman history.
name: Roman Baths and Open Air Museum
address: Hacı Bayram, Çankırı Cd. No:43, 06050 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Narrow, curving lake surrounded by pine trees on the Middle East Technical University campus.
detail_description: Lake Eymir, situated within the Middle East Technical University campus in Ankara, Turkey, offers a tranquil retreat for nature enthusiasts and visitors seeking a break from urban life. The picturesque lake is surrounded by pine trees and lush greenery, providing an ideal setting for activities such as cycling, jogging, and leisurely walks. It's a popular spot for picnics and birdwatching, with opportunities to observe various bird species.
name: Lake Eymir
address: Oran, 06450 Çankaya/Ankara, Türkiye

detail_description: The Aslanhane Mosque is an imposing, historical mosque in Ankara. It was built by the Seljuk Turks in the 12th century, and features stunning inner architecture. The mosque is open to tourists 24 hours a day, and features a section for women prayers at the upper stage. The toilets are nicely clean, but you need to pay for using them. The carpets are very nice and coincide with the style of the mosque - worth visiting if you're ever in Ankara!
name: Aslanhane Mosque
address: 06240, Kale, Kale Sk., 06250 Ankara, Türkiye

name: Hacı Bayram-ı Veli Tomb
address: Hacı Bayram, Şht. Keskin Sk. No:7, 06050 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Museum exhibiting weaponry & artifacts from war of independence in imposing, 2-story stone building.
detail_description: Nestled in an impressive two-story stone structure, the Museum of the War of Independence stands as a testament to Turkey's rich history and struggle for freedom. This museum showcases an array of weaponry and artifacts that tell the story of a nation’s fight for independence. Originally designed by Architect Salim Bey between 1915-1920, this building served as the First Parliament Building and was pivotal in parliamentary activities until 1924.
name: Museum of the War of Independence
address: Hacı Bayram, Cumhuriyet Cd. No: 2/1, 06050 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Ankara, Turkey’s cosmopolitan capital, sits in the country’s central Anatolia region. It’s a center for the performing arts, home to the State Opera and Ballet, the Presidential Symphony Orchestra and several national theater companies. Overlooking the city is Anitkabir, the enormous hilltop mausoleum of Kemal Atatürk, modern Turkey’s first president, who declared Ankara the capital in 1923.
detail_description: Ankara, the vibrant capital of Turkey, is a hub for the performing arts and rich in historical significance. The city is home to iconic landmarks such as Anitkabir, the grand mausoleum of Kemal Atatürk, Turkey's first president. This site also houses the Ataturk Museum, displaying his personal items and gifts.
name: Ankara
address: Türkiye

excerpt: Opened in 2010, this museum hosts modern-art exhibits & events in a former railway workshop.
detail_description: CerModern, located in Ankara, is a contemporary art gallery housed in a restored railway factory. Since its establishment in 2010, it has been a hub for cultural and artistic activities, hosting national and international art events and exhibitions. The museum also offers educational programs, concerts, festivals, film screenings, and an art library with reference books on modern arts.
name: Cermodern
address: Hacı Bayram, Altınsoy Cd. No:3, 06101 Sıhhıye / Altındağ/Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Huge shopping mall since 1999 with international brands, underground parking, a food court & cinema.
detail_description: Located in Ankara, ANKAmall is a massive shopping center that has been serving visitors since 1999. With an impressive selection of international brands, the mall offers a diverse shopping experience. Visitors can take advantage of convenient underground parking and explore numerous dining options at the food court. Additionally, entertainment options include a cinema and arcade games for all ages to enjoy. The mall prioritizes accessibility with wheelchair-accessible facilities, including parking and entrances.
name: ANKAmall
address: Konya Devlet Yolu, Gazi, Mevlana Blv. No:2, 06560 Yenimahalle/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Marine attraction at the Nata Vega Outlet featuring an underwater tunnel with fish, sharks & more.
detail_description: Aqua Vega Aquarium, situated within the Nata Vega Outlet in Ankara, Turkey, offers a mesmerizing experience for visitors. The aquarium boasts an impressive underwater tunnel showcasing a diverse range of marine life including fish and sharks. It is not just a tourist attraction but also serves as an educational hub with a focus on conservation efforts. Families with kids can enjoy spending quality time here while observing various sea creatures from different parts of the world.
name: Aqua Vega Aquarium
address: Akşemsettin, 2308. Sk. 1/A, 06630 Mamak/Ankara, Türkiye

excerpt: Museum of the Turkish Republic, housed in the Second Grand National Assembly of Turkey.
detail_description: The Republic Museum (The Second Parliament Building) is located in the historical Second Grand National Assembly of Turkey. It offers a glimpse into the early years of the Turkish Republic, showcasing artifacts and mementos from former Turkish presidents. Visitors can explore exhibits dating back to the Paleolithic age, spanning over 11,500 years of history. The museum provides an immersive experience into the political and social atmosphere of that era, making it a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts.
name: Republic Museum (The Second Parliament Building)
address: Doğanbey Mahallesi, Cumhuriyet Cd. No:7, 06050 Altındağ/Ankara, Türkiye
